definition: see 磅秤 scale/platform balance/(loanword) pound (unit of weight, about 454 grams)
variant of 稱|称[cheng1], to weigh

sentences.english: He weighed himself on the scale.
For her birthday, he bought her a brand new bathroom scale.
sentences.chinese: 爲了她的生日，他給她買了最新款的浴室磅秤。

sentences.english: All right, put them on the scale.
sentences.chinese: 好的，請把行李擺在磅秤上。

sentences.english: Put these labels on your luggage, please And then I'll put then on the scales.
sentences.chinese: 請把貨籤系在行李上，然後我把行李放到磅秤上。

sentences.english: Please put all of your baggage on the scale.
sentences.chinese: 請把所有的行李放在磅秤上。

sentences.english: The scales broke down when I was weighing myself this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我稱體重時磅秤碰壞了。

sentences.english: Please put your luggage on this scale.
sentences.chinese: 請您把行李放在磅秤上過秤。

sentences.english: If we want to measure our body fat, the scale is an archaic vestige of the 20 century.
sentences.chinese: 假若我們想測量身體脂肪，磅秤是20世紀陳舊遺蹟。

sentences.english: Like the scale, the controls are only a measuring tool.
sentences.chinese: 像磅秤一樣，控制只是測量工具。

sentences.english: When losing large amounts of weight, the scale is a useful tool to gauge the change.
sentences.chinese: 當大量減重時，磅秤是一個有用的工具來衡量變化。

sentences.english: Would you please put your baggage on the scales?
sentences.chinese: 請把你的行李放在磅秤上過秤，好嗎？

sentences.english: He weighed himself on the bathroom scales.
Please put your things on the scale.
sentences.chinese: 請把你的行李放在磅秤上。

definition: the tray or pan of a steelyard
balance consisting of steelyard with a pan/CL:臺|台[tai2]
